body: Is Beta-Thalassemia is associated with a mutation or deletion of the gene that codes for alpha globin?
ideal_answer: Beta-thalassemia, one of the most common single-gene disorders, is the result of reduced or absent production of β-globin chains
beta-thalassemia, one of the most common single-gene disorders, is the result of reduced or absent production of β-globin chains.

snippets.text: Beta-thalassemia, one of the most common single-gene disorders, is the result of reduced or absent production of β-globin chains
The beta-thalassemia syndromes are a heterogeneous group of genetic disorders characterized by reduced or absent expression of the beta-globin gene
